00057 /**
00058  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00059  * Synopsis:
00060  *
00061  * CHP constructor.
00062  *
00063  * Note that most CHP data is completely ignored excepting the alleles
00064  * and the probe set id.
00065  * Be only using three pieces of  CHP data from the CHP file
00066  * (probe set id, allele1 and allele2) allows the design to be coallece CHP
00067  * files into the TSV data model for the DMET2, Genotype Short Report.
00068  * This is signficant because research
00069  * at Affy after DMET3 is release will able to use the Genotype Short Report
00070  * input for DMET3. Creaing text files of sample data can be done in Excel
00071  *  and this avoids creating CHP files soley for the purpose of
00072  *  running this translation program. 
00073  * 
00074  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment.
00075  * @param tsvColumnDefinitions  - CHP data is coerced into TSV fields. 
00076  * @param tcdSize - size of tsvColumnDefinitions
00077  * @param gotm  - the genotype override table model.
00078  *
00079  */
00080 /*****************************************************************************/
00081 TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel(
00082   const RunTimeEnvironment& rte,
00083   const TittmColumnDefinition tsvColumnDefinitions[],
00084   size_t tcdSize,
00085   GenotypeOverrideTableModel *gotm) : m_gotm(gotm)
00086 {
00087 
00088   m_type                 = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CHP;
00089   m_chpData              = NULL;
00090   m_genoCallCoder        = NULL;
00091   m_callsFileReader      = NULL;
00092 
00093   _initializeColumnDefinitions(rte, tsvColumnDefinitions, tcdSize);
00094 
00095   if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_streamType == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_BATCH_FOLDER) {
00096     // read blob file in batch folder
00097     m_blockReader.initFolder(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputBatchFolder);
00098     if (!m_blockReader.open()) {
00099       APT_ERR_ABORT(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputBatchFolder + ": failed to open batch folder with blob for reading.");
00100     }
00101     m_type = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_BATCH_FOLDER;
00102   }
00103   else if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_streamType == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CALLS_FILE) {
00104     // read calls file
00105     m_callsFileReader = new CallsFileReader();
00106     if (!m_callsFileReader->readFile(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputCallsFile)) {
00107       APT_ERR_ABORT(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputCallsFile + ": failed to read input calls file.");
00108     }
00109     m_type = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CALLS_FILE;
00110   }
00111   else {
00112     // Ok, we shouldn't be trapping this exception here, but
00113     // during the input validation. This is a programming error
00114     // so just assert.
00115     APT_ERR_ASSERT(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles.size() != 0, "");
00116 
00117     for (size_t i = 0; i < rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles.size(); i++) {
00118       m_chpExperimentFileQueue.push_back(
00119         rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles[i]);
00120     }
00121   }
00122 
00123   return;
00124 
00125 }
00126 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel

00129 /**
00130  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00131  * Synopsis:
00132  *
00133  * Tsv constructor.
00134  *
00135  * A DMET2 constructor for the Genotype Short Report input of genotype
00136  * data. The schema for this object is the schema for the Genotype Short
00137  * Report even for CHP files. 
00138  *
00139  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00140  * @param inputTsvFileName - the file with the Genotype Short Report data. 
00141  * @param tsvColumnDefinitions - the Genotype Short Report columns
00142  * @param tcdSize - the tsvColumnDefinitions size
00143  * @param strictTsvColumnOrder - when true the columns must be in order. 
00144  * @param tsvExperimentColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the experiment. 
00145  * @param tsvGeneColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the gene. 
00146  * @param tsvProbeSetColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the probe set id.. 
00147  * @param gotm - the single instance Genotype Override Table Model.
00148  *
00149  */
00150 /*****************************************************************************/
00151 TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel(
00152   const RunTimeEnvironment& rte,
00153   const std::string& inputTsvFileName,
00154   const TittmColumnDefinition tsvColumnDefinitions[],
00155   size_t tcdSize,
00156   bool strictTsvColumnOrder,
00157   int tsvExperimentColumn,
00158   int tsvGeneColumn,
00159   int tsvProbeSetColumn,
00160   GenotypeOverrideTableModel *gotm) : m_gotm(gotm)
00161 {
00162 
00163   m_type                 = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_TSV;
00164   m_strictTsvColumnOrder = strictTsvColumnOrder;
00165   m_tsvExperimentColumn  = tsvExperimentColumn;
00166   m_tsvGeneColumn        = tsvGeneColumn;
00167   m_tsvFileName          = inputTsvFileName;
00168   m_tsvProbeSetColumn    = tsvProbeSetColumn;
00169   m_chpData              = NULL;
00170   m_genoCallCoder        = NULL;
00171   m_callsFileReader          = NULL;
00172 
00173   _initializeColumnDefinitions(rte, tsvColumnDefinitions, tcdSize);
00174 
00175 
00176   _openTsvFile(rte);
00177 
00178 
00179 }

00194 {
00195 
00196   if (m_tsvColumnDefinition.size()  > 0) {

00198   }
00199 
00200   return 0;

00206 /**
00207  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData
00208  * Synopsis
00209  * 
00210  * It is required that memory usage should constant as files and
00211  * experiments are streamed. This method resets the object to
00212  * no data other than the meta data required to open the next stream
00213  * (file). 
00214  *
00215  * Calls to this API should clear all memory in between experiments.
00216  *
00217  */
00218 /*****************************************************************************/
00219 void  TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData()
00220 {
00221 
00222   m_rows.clear() ;
00223 
00224   if (m_chpData != NULL) {
00225     delete m_chpData;
00226     m_chpData = NULL;
00227   }
00228 
00229 
00230   return;
00231 
00232 }
00233 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData

00236 /**
00237  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getColumnName
00238  * Synopsis:
00239  *
00240  * Get the column name for a column index, i.e. integer -> std::string.
00241  * It's an assertion error to pass in an out of bound index. 
00242  *
00243  * @param column - the 0 based column index for the column in question.
00244  * 
00245  * @return m_columnName - the name corresponding to column. 
00246  */
00247 /*****************************************************************************/
00248 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getColumnName(int column)
00249 {
00250 
00251   // This should always be true unless some constructor is created
00252   // that doesn't initialize this.
00253   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
00254 
00255   APT_ERR_ASSERT((column >= 0) && (column < columnCount()), "");
00256 
00257   return m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName;
00258 
00259 }

00263 /**
00264  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString
00265  * Synopsis:
00266  * 
00267  * Debug convienance routine that std::stringifies and entire row. Also
00268  * used in error messages. All columns are "separated" by a single comma.
00269  * If the data within a column contains a column there is no attempt made
00270  * quote the columns. Empty columns will have comma sequences as ",,,". 
00271  * column 1 2   3 
00272  * data   A B,C D => "A,B,C,D"
00273  * 
00274  * @param row - integer of the row, 0 based
00275  * 
00276  * @return std::string - the comma separated std::string
00277  */
00278 /*****************************************************************************/
00279 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString(const int row)  const
00280 {
00281 
00282   APT_ERR_ASSERT((row >= 0) && (row < size()), "");
00283 
00284   std::stringstream rowSStr;
00285 
00286   for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount(); j++) {
00287     rowSStr << m_rows[row][j];
00288 
00289     if (j < (columnCount() - 1)) {
00290       rowSStr << ",";
00291     }
00292 
00293   } // for each column
00294 
00295   return rowSStr.str();
00296 
00297 }
00298 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString

00301 /**
00302  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment:
00303  * Synopsis:
00304  *
00305  *  A wrapper that wraps the appropriate TSV for CHP read next experiment
00306  * method. The TranslationEngine calls this method.       
00307  *
00308  * 
00309  * 
00310  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00311  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model. 
00312  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall
00313  *            - The copy number 0 designation per gene std::map. 
00314  * 
00315  * @return - the number of records read or 0 if no more records are left.
00316  */
00317 /*****************************************************************************/
00318 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map< std::string, std::string> & geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map< std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
00319 {
00320 
00321   if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_BATCH_FOLDER) {
00322     return _readNextExperimentBatchFolder(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, geneCopyNumber);
00323   }
00324   else if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CALLS_FILE) {
00325     return _readNextExperimentCallsFile(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, geneCopyNumber);
00326   }
00327   else if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_TSV) {
00328     return _readNextExperimentTsv(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall);
00329   }
00330   else if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CHP) {
00331     return _readNextExperimentCHP(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, geneCopyNumber);
00332   }
00333 
00334   return 0;
00335 
00336 }
00337 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment

00340 /**
00341  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment:
00342  * Synopsis:
00343  *
00344  * Genotype Short Report files are NOT sorted by experiment, but need
00345  * to be in order to be streamed. If this program detects an unsorted
00346  * Genotype Short Report then it aborts. However, before it aborts
00347  * it sorts the TSV file and creates a new copy of the file
00348  * with ".sorted" as an extension. In this way the user can
00349  * simply call the program a second time using the ".sorted" file
00350  * and then continue on. 
00351  * 
00352  * This is utility routine used independent of translating calls. Use this
00353  * routine with its own option switch as a convienance to sort
00354  * an input genotype short report file. Sorting is a requirement
00355  * for streaming. 
00356  *
00357  *
00358  * @rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment which contains the name of the file to be sorted. 
00359  *
00360  * @return - void, creates a new file of sorted records. Throws exceptions
00361  *           on IO errors.
00362  */
00363 /*****************************************************************************/
00364 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte)
00365 {
00366 
00367   // This should never happen unless a new constructor is created
00368   // that doesn't initialize columns.
00369   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
00370 
00371   TsvFile sortTsv;
00372 
00373   std::string sortName = m_tsvFileName + ".sort.txt";
00374 
00375   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, "sortTsvFileByExperiment: " + m_tsvFileName
00376                +  " -> " + sortName);
00377 
00378   for (size_t i = 0; i < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(); i++) {
00379 
00380     sortTsv.defineColumn(0, i, m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName);
00381   }
00382 
00383   //
00384   m_tsv.m_optAutoTrim   = true; // remove '"'s
00385   m_tsv.m_optQuoteChar1 = 0;    // ignore "'"s
00386 
00387 
00388   if (m_tsv.open(m_tsvFileName) != TSV_OK) {
00389     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": failed opening input Tsv file.");
00390   }
00391 
00392   m_tsv.headersBegin();
00393 
00394   std::string key;
00395   std::string value;
00396   sortTsv.addHeaderComment(" File generated by sortTsvFileByExperiment.");
00397   while (m_tsv.headersNext(key, value) == TSV_OK) {
00398     sortTsv.addHeader(key, value);
00399   }
00400 
00401   sortTsv.writeTsv_v1(sortName);
00402 
00403   int row = 0;
00404   while (m_tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00405 
00406     m_rows.resize(row + 1);
00407     m_rows[row].resize(m_tsvColumnCount, "");
00408 
00409     // Read in a row, one column at a time.
00410     for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
00411       std::string columnValue;
00412       if (m_tsv.get(0, tsvColumn, columnValue) != TSV_OK) {
00413         APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.get != TSV_OK");
00414       }
00415       if (!columnValue.empty()) {
00416         m_rows[row][m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]] = columnValue;
00417       }
00418     }
00419 
00420     m_experimentRowIndex[m_rows[row][m_tsvExperimentColumn]].push_back(row);
00421     row++;
00422   }
00423 
00424   std::map<std::string, std::vector< int > >::iterator itSV;
00425 
00426   row = 0;
00427   for (itSV = m_experimentRowIndex.begin(); itSV != m_experimentRowIndex.end(); itSV++) {
00428 
00429     for (size_t i = 0; i < itSV->second.size() ; i++) {
00430       for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
00431         sortTsv.set(0, tsvColumn,  m_rows[itSV->second[i]][tsvColumn]);
00432       }
00433       sortTsv.writeLevel(0);
00434       row++;
00435     }
00436   }
00437 
00438   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, ToStr(row) + " sorted Genotype records written to " + sortName);
00439 
00440   sortTsv.close();
00441 
00442   m_tsv.close();
00443 
00444   clearData();
00445 
00446   return;
00447 
00448 }
00449 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment

00472 /*****************************************************************************/
00473 /*****************************************************************************/
00474 /**
00475  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet:
00476  * Synopsis:
00477  *
00478  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00479  *
00480  * Translates a probe set id's textual 'allele1' and 'allele2'
00481  * from the CHP file using the APIs found in the GenoCallCoder. 
00482  *
00483  *  The CHP calls are encoded as "A/A" or "A/B" or "B/B", etc. These
00484  *  need to be translated into the actual alleles in the annotation file.
00485  *  Do the look up in the GenoCallCoder and return the bases.
00486  * 
00487  * Note: the report alleles are not retrieved here but instead are
00488  * imported at start up time using all the probe sets and alleles in the
00489  * translation table.
00490  *
00491  * Also note: the CHP will contain many more probe sets then are defined in
00492  * the translation table. When this API returns false then this is
00493  * the deciding factor when to ignore a probe set marker in the
00494  * CHP file and the data is dropped on the floor. 
00495  *
00496  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment.
00497  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table.
00498  * @param dbad - the DmetBiAllelicData with probe set and call data.
00499  *               Note: BiAllelic is a misnomer, multi allelic is represented as
00500  *               well.
00501  * @param genoCallDecoder - the object that does translation from "A/A" -> "TGT/TTT".
00502  * @param allele1 - returned base for the ALLELE1 column.
00503  * @param allele2 - returned base for the ALLELE2 column.
00504  *
00505  * @return - true if the probeSet exists  in the translation table,
00506  *           the allele1 and allele2 std::strings
00507  */
00508 /*****************************************************************************/
00509 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet(const class RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm,  affymetrix_calvin_data::DmetBiAllelicData & dbad,  std::string & allele1, std::string & allele2)
00510 {
00511 
00512 
00513 
00514   APT_ERR_ASSERT(!dbad.name.empty(), "");
00515 
00516   std::string probeSet    = dbad.name;
00517 
00518   if (ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex.count(probeSet) == 0) {
00519     return false;
00520   }
00521 
00522 
00523   std::string decodedAbstractCall;
00524   std::string decodedCall;
00525   std::string reportCall;
00526 
00527   allele1.clear();
00528   allele2.clear();
00529 
00530   bool probeSetSwitchStrand = ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) && ttm.m_rows[ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex[probeSet][0]][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_SWITCH_STRAND)] == "Y");
00531 
00532 
00533   decodedCall = m_genoCallCoder->genotypeCallNumToReferenceAllele(probeSet, dbad.call);
00534 
00535   if (decodedCall.empty()) {
00536     APT_ERR_ABORT("Empty reference call returned by abstractAlleleToReferenceAllele.");
00537   }
00538 
00539   std::string first, second, copyNumber;
00540 
00541 
00542   if (!pcrecpp::RE("^([\\w\\d\\-]+)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first)) {
00543 
00544     if (! pcrecpp::RE("^(\\w+|\\-)/(\\w+|\\-)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first, &second)) {
00545       APT_ERR_ABORT(probeSet + ": unknown call? " + decodedCall);
00546     }
00547   }
00548 
00549   // Copy Number 0 translation
00550 
00551   if ((first == "17") || (first == "ZeroCopyNumber")) {
00552     first = "0";
00553   }
00554 
00555   allele1 = first;
00556 
00557   if (first == "NotAvailable") {
00558     // Returning false causes the marker to be ignored, exactly the behavior
00559     // required.
00560     //    return false;
00561   }
00562 
00563   if (!second.empty()) {
00564     allele2 = second;
00565   }
00566 
00567 
00568   if (probeSetSwitchStrand) {
00569 
00570     allele1 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele1);
00571     allele2 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele2);
00572 
00573   }
00574 
00575   return true;
00576 
00577 }
00578 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet
00579 
00580 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromAbstractAlleles(const class RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, 
00581                                                 const std::string& sProbeset, const std::string& sCall, std::string & allele1, std::string & allele2)
00582 {
00583 
00584   if (ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex.count(sProbeset) == 0) {
00585     return false;
00586   }
00587 
00588 
00589   std::string decodedAbstractCall;
00590   std::string decodedCall;
00591   std::string reportCall;
00592 
00593   allele1.clear();
00594   allele2.clear();
00595 
00596   bool probeSetSwitchStrand = ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) && ttm.m_rows[ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex[sProbeset][0]][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_SWITCH_STRAND)] == "Y");
00597 
00598 
00599   if (sCall == "NoCall") {
00600     decodedCall = "NoCall/NoCall";
00601   }
00602   else {
00603     decodedCall = m_genoCallCoder->abstractAlleleToReferenceAllele(sProbeset, sCall);
00604   }
00605 
00606   if (decodedCall.empty()) {
00607     APT_ERR_ABORT("Empty reference call returned by abstractAlleleToReferenceAllele.");
00608   }
00609 
00610   std::string first, second, copyNumber;
00611 
00612 
00613   if (!pcrecpp::RE("^([\\w\\d\\-]+)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first)) {
00614 
00615     if (! pcrecpp::RE("^(\\w+|\\-)/(\\w+|\\-)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first, &second)) {
00616       APT_ERR_ABORT(sProbeset + ": unknown call? " + decodedCall);
00617     }
00618   }
00619 
00620   // Copy Number 0 translation
00621 
00622   if ((first == "17") || (first == "ZeroCopyNumber")) {
00623     first = "0";
00624   }
00625 
00626   allele1 = first;
00627 
00628   if (first == "NotAvailable") {
00629     // Returning false causes the marker to be ignored, exactly the behavior
00630     // required.
00631     //    return false;
00632   }
00633 
00634   if (!second.empty()) {
00635     allele2 = second;
00636   }
00637 
00638 
00639   if (probeSetSwitchStrand) {
00640 
00641     allele1 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele1);
00642     allele2 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele2);
00643 
00644   }
00645 
00646   return true;
00647 
00648 }
00649 
00650 /*****************************************************************************/
00651 /*****************************************************************************/
00652 /**
00653  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet:
00654  * Synopsis:
00655  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00656  *
00657  * The CHP file doesn't contain the gene. However, the assay id (probe set)
00658  * is distinct per translation table so it can be looked up in the
00659  * translation table.
00660  *
00661  * @param probeSet - the marker for which to get the gene
00662  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table containing the gene
00663  *
00664  * @return - gene as std::string, empty if the probeSet doesn't exist
00665  */
00666 /*****************************************************************************/
00667 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet(const std::string probeSet,   const TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00668 {
00669 
00670   std::string gene;
00671 
00672   if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet) < 0) {
00673     return gene;
00674   }
00675 
00676   gene = ttm.m_rows[ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet)][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_GENE)];
00677 
00678   return gene;
00679 }
00680 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet
00681 /*****************************************************************************/
00682 /*****************************************************************************/
00683 /**
00684  * searchParams
00685  * Synopsis:
00686  *
00687  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid and
00688  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile.
00689  *
00690  * The calvin_files directory contains APIs to search for headers  or
00691  * parameters in the CHP file's various inheritance tree. However, these
00692  * APIs are specific the the class implemented for. This search
00693  * searchs the entire inheritance graph in one convienant API.
00694  * This function also convienantly handles all the conversion from
00695  * WCS to std::string. 
00696  *
00697  * Note: This is not the most efficient API but the two functions
00698  * being helped are
00699  * initialization functions only used at start up and hence performance
00700  * is not a factor. 
00701  *
00702  * @param gdh - GenericDataHeader from m_chpData
00703  * @params searchName - what to search for.
00704  * @params searchValue - the return value. 
00705  *
00706  * @return - searchValue, if found
00707  */
00708 /*****************************************************************************/
00709 static void searchParams(affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader & gdh, const std::string searchName ,  std::string &searchValue )
00710 {
00711 
00712   if (!searchValue.empty()) {
00713     return;
00714   }
00715 
00716   ParameterNameValueTypeIt itPNVT;
00717   ParameterNameValueTypeIt jtPNVT;
00718 
00719   gdh.GetNameValIterators(itPNVT, jtPNVT);
00720 
00721   for (; itPNVT != jtPNVT; itPNVT++) {
00722 
00723     if (StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNVT->GetName()) == searchName ) {
00724       searchValue = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNVT->ToString());
00725       return;
00726     }
00727   }
00728 
00729   std::vector<GenericDataHeader>::iterator itGDH;
00730   std::vector<GenericDataHeader>::iterator jtGDH;
00731 
00732   gdh.GetParentIterators(itGDH, jtGDH);
00733 
00734   for (; itGDH != jtGDH ; itGDH++) {
00735     searchParams(*itGDH, searchName, searchValue);
00736   }
00737 
00738   return;
00739 
00740 }
00741 // end searchParams
00742 /*****************************************************************************/
00743 /*****************************************************************************/
00744 /**
00745  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid:
00746  * Synopsis:
00747  *
00748  * Helper function to _initializeNextExperimentCHPFile
00749  * 
00750  *   Returns the CHP file assay id. Broken out due to confusion about
00751  * which GUID is the right guid. Also, some prototype CHP files stuff
00752  * the GUID in a different place than that required by the 
00753  * canonical gd.ArrayIdentifier(). If gd.ArrayIdentifier fails then
00754  * searchParams is called. Only prototype CHPS files have exhibited this
00755  * behavior. 
00756  *
00757  * 
00758  * 
00759  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00760  * @param gd - GenericData from m_chpData
00761  * 
00762  * @return - guid, The GUID std::string.
00763  */
00764 /*****************************************************************************/
00765 /*****************************************************************************/
00766 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericData & gd)
00767 {
00768 
00769 
00770   //m_chpGuid = m_chpData->GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr()->GetFileId();
00771   //m_chpGuid = gd.ArrayIdentifier();
00772 
00773   AffymetrixGuidType guid;
00774 
00775   guid = gd.ArrayIdentifier();
00776 
00777 
00778   if (guid.empty()) {
00779     GenericDataHeader* gdh = gd.Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00780 
00781     if (gdh  == NULL)  {
00782       APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't find header: " + ToStr(ARRAY_TYPE_IDENTIFIER));
00783     }
00784     searchParams(*gdh, StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ARRAY_ID_PARAM_NAME) ,guid);
00785     if (guid.empty()) {
00786       APT_ERR_ABORT(m_chpExperimentFile + ": invalid CHP file, missing Array ID GUID (" + ToStr(ARRAY_TYPE_IDENTIFIER) + ").");
00787     }
00788   }
00789 
00790   return guid;
00791 
00792 }
00793 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid
00794 /*****************************************************************************/
00795 /*****************************************************************************/
00796 /**
00797  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet:
00798  * Synopsis:
00799  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00800  *
00801  * The CHP file doesn't contain the external id. However, the probe set id
00802  * is distinct per translation table so it can be looked up in the
00803  * translation table.
00804  *
00805  * @param probeSet - the marker
00806  * @param ttm      - the single instance translation table
00807  *
00808  * @return - external id (common name)  as std::string, empty if the probeSet doesn't exist
00809  */
00810 /*****************************************************************************/
00811 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet(const std::string probeSet,   const TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00812 {
00813 
00814   std::string externalId;
00815 
00816   if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet) < 0) {
00817     return externalId;
00818   }
00819 
00820   externalId = ttm.m_rows[ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet)][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_COMMON_NAME)];
00821 
00822   return externalId;
00823 }
00824 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet
00825 /*****************************************************************************/
00826 /*****************************************************************************/
00827 /**
00828  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00829  * Synopsis: 
00830  *
00831  * Helper function to the constructers
00832  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00833  * 
00834  * Initialize the definition of columns data structure. This is compared
00835  * against the input TSV file when it is opened for integrity. 
00836  * 
00837  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00838  * @param columnDefinitions - the typically hard coded columns. 
00839  * @param tcdSize - the size of columnDefinitions. 
00840  *
00841  */
00842 /*****************************************************************************/
00843 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, const TittmColumnDefinition columnDefinitions[], int tcdSize)
00844 {
00845 
00846   m_tsvColumnDefinition.clear();
00847 
00848   // Iterate so we can doublecheck the m_index value.
00849   for (int i = 0; i < tcdSize; i++) {
00850 
00851     APT_ERR_ASSERT(columnDefinitions[i].m_index == i, "");
00852 
00853     m_tsvColumnDefinition.push_back(columnDefinitions[i]);
00854   }
00855 
00856   return;
00857 }
00858 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00859 /*****************************************************************************/
00860 /*****************************************************************************/
00861 /**
00862  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile:
00863  * Synopsis:
00864  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00865  * 
00866  * Open the next CHP file, read the headers and postion things to read the
00867  * first data record.
00868  *
00869  * Initialize the global report alleles.
00870  * The report alleles global to all experiments are 
00871  * initialized here. There are two reasons for this:
00872  * 1.) The GenoCallCoder requires parameters taken from a CHP file
00873  * specific to this set of CHP files.
00874  * 2.) The first CHP file is read for the first time here. The parameters
00875  * are take from that file here. 
00876  * 
00877  *
00878  * @param rte - the RunTimeEnvironment with the command line list
00879  *              of all the experiment CHP files.
00880  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model updated with the
00881  * report alleles on the first call. 
00882  *
00883  * @return - true if ok, false otherwise. Throws Exception on IO error. Updates the ttm with the report alleles on first call. 
00884  */
00885 /*****************************************************************************/
00886 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00887 {
00888 
00889   bool okToContinue = true;
00890 
00891   if (m_chpExperimentFileQueue.size() == 0) {
00892     return false;
00893   }
00894 
00895   m_chpExperimentFile = m_chpExperimentFileQueue.front();
00896   m_chpExperimentFileQueue.pop_front();
00897 
00898 
00899   // Open the file and read the headers.
00900   // I traced this "Read" call back to GenericFileReader.cpp
00901   // and "Read" only reads the headers.
00902 
00903 
00904   m_chpData = new affymetrix_calvin_io::CHPMultiDataData;
00905 
00906   affymetrix_calvin_io::CHPMultiDataFileReader reader;
00907   reader.SetFilename(m_chpExperimentFile);
00908 
00909   reader.Read(*m_chpData);
00910 
00911   FileHeader *chpFileHeader = m_chpData->GetFileHeader();
00912 
00913   DataGroupHdrIt itDG, jtDG;
00914 
00915   chpFileHeader->GetDataGroupIts(itDG, jtDG);
00916 
00917   for (; itDG != jtDG; itDG++) {
00918 
00919     DataSetHdrIt itDSH, jtDSH;
00920 
00921     itDG->GetDataSetIterators(itDSH, jtDSH);
00922 
00923   }
00924 
00925   ParameterNameValueTypeList summaryList = m_chpData->GetSummaryParams();
00926 
00927 
00928   ParameterNameValueTypeList::iterator  itPNV;
00929 
00930   for (itPNV = summaryList.begin(); itPNV != summaryList.end(); itPNV++) {
00931     std::string name = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNV->GetName());
00932   }
00933 
00934   ParameterNameValueTypeList algorithmList = m_chpData->GetAlgParams();
00935 
00936   GenericData & gd = m_chpData->GetGenericData();
00937 
00938   WStringVector names;
00939   gd.DataGroupNames(names);
00940 
00941   for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00942 
00943     std::string dataTypeName = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(MultiDataDataSetNames[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]]);
00944 
00945     m_chpDataTypeSize[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]] = m_chpData->GetEntryCount(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]);
00946 
00947     if (m_chpDataTypeSize[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]] == 0) {
00948       Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, dataTypeName  + ": group has no records (0 size)\n");
00949     }
00950 
00951   }
00952 
00953   // EXPERIMENT NAME, set to the file name, minus directories
00954   m_experimentName = Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile);
00955   bool okMatch = pcrecpp::RE("\\.[cC][hH][Pp]$").PartialMatch(m_experimentName);
00956 
00957   APT_ERR_ASSERT(okMatch, "");
00958 
00959   if (m_experimentName.empty()) {
00960     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_chpExperimentFile + ": invalid experiment file name.");
00961   }
00962 
00963   m_chpGuid = _getCHPGuid(rte, gd);
00964 
00965   //call-encoding-version=1.0 (ASCII)
00966   //call-encoding-max-alleles=6 (Int32)
00967   //call-encoding-data-size=UCHAR (ASCII)
00968   std::string versionHeader = "call-encoding-version";
00969   std::string maxAllelesHeader = "call-encoding-max-alleles";
00970   std::string dataSizeHeader = "call-encoding-data-size";
00971   std::string version, maxAlleles, dataSize;
00972 
00973   
00974   GenericDataHeader* gdh = gd.Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00975   
00976   
00977   searchParams(  *gdh, versionHeader, version );
00978   searchParams(  *gdh, maxAllelesHeader, maxAlleles );
00979   searchParams(  *gdh, dataSizeHeader, dataSize );
00980 
00981   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + versionHeader +  ": {" + version + "}" );
00982   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " +  maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + maxAlleles +  "}" );
00983   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + dataSize+  "}" );
00984 
00985   if ( m_genoCallCoder == NULL ) {
00986     if ( rte.m_adtOpts.m_prototypeCHPFiles ) {
00987       m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(6, "UCHAR", "1.0", '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
00988     }
00989     else {
00990       m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(atoi(maxAlleles.c_str()), dataSize, version, '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
00991     }
00992 
00993     if ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) &&  !rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreReportAllele) {
00994 
00995       ttm.setReportAlleles( *m_genoCallCoder);
00996     }
00997 
00998     m_chpVersion = version;
00999     m_chpDataEncodingSize = dataSize;
01000     m_chpMaxAlleles = maxAlleles;
01001   }
01002   else if ( ! rte.m_adtOpts.m_prototypeCHPFiles && ((version != m_chpVersion) || (dataSize != m_chpDataEncodingSize) ||  (maxAlleles != m_chpMaxAlleles ) ) ){
01003       Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, std::string("Conflicting CHP type: ") + Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + versionHeader +  ": {" + version + "},  " +  maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + maxAlleles +  "}, " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + dataSize +  "}" );
01004       APT_ERR_ABORT(std::string("CHP files with different versions detected, was expecting: ") + versionHeader + ": {" + m_chpVersion + "}, " + maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + m_chpMaxAlleles + "}, " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + m_chpDataEncodingSize + "}");
01005 
01006   }
01007 
01008 
01009 
01010   return okToContinue;
01011 
01012 
01013 }
01014 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile
01015 /*****************************************************************************/
01016 /*****************************************************************************/
01017 /**
01018  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
01019  * Synopsis:
01020  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile.
01021  * 
01022  * Initialize the TsvFile object columns from the column definitions.
01023  * The TSV file does not have to be in column order, but this
01024  * method always puts them in column order internally so that
01025  * indexing by column index integer can take place. 
01026  *
01027  *
01028  * @param m_tsvFileName - The name of the TsvFile in question used for messaging.
01029  * @param tsv           - The TsvFile object in question corresponding m_tsvFileName. 
01030  *
01031  * @returns false - on error.
01032  *
01033  */
01034 /*****************************************************************************/
01035 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
01036 {
01037 
01038   bool         okTsvColumns = true;
01039   std::stringstream msgSStr;
01040 
01041   m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex.resize(tsv.getColumnCount(0), -1);
01042 
01043 
01044   for (size_t column = 0; column < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(); column++) {
01045 
01046     // find the tsv column index for this
01047     int tsvColumn
01048     = tsv.cname2cidx(0, m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName);
01049 
01050     if (tsvColumn < 0) {
01051       okTsvColumns = false;
01052       msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
01053       msgSStr << "column [" << (column + 1) << "], \"";
01054       msgSStr << m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName << "\"  not found." << endl;
01055       continue;
01056     }
01057 
01058     m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]
01059     = m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_index;
01060 
01061   }
01062 
01063   if (!okTsvColumns) {
01064     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
01065   }
01066 
01067   return okTsvColumns;
01068 
01069 }
01070 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
01071 /*****************************************************************************/
01072 /*****************************************************************************/
01073 /**
01074  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
01075  * Synopsis:
01076  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile
01077  *
01078  * It is not normal Affymetrix practice to require to have only the
01079  * set of columns required nor is it normal practice to have those
01080  * columns in any order. The TsvFile object can access columns by
01081  * name independent of order. However, there exists requirements
01082  * for this application to enforce column order as well as column order
01083  * enforce only columns diseried.
01084  * 
01085  * This helper is used to enforce strict column ordering when required.
01086  * Inspect the first line of the TsvFile and insure the appropriate header
01087  * column names exist one-to-one and in the same order
01088  * with all the column definitions. Note this is only required for certain
01089  * files such as the human generated TranslationTable.xls spreadsheet.
01090  *
01091  * @param inputTsvFileName - the Tsv file in question
01092  * @param tsv - the TsvFile object that is opened and corresponds to
01093  *              inputTsvFileName
01094  *
01095  * @return false - the TSV columns are not complete or in column order. 
01096  */
01097 /*****************************************************************************/
01098 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
01099 {
01100 
01101   bool okHeaderLine = true;
01102 
01103   int invalidHeaderCount = 0;
01104 
01105   std::stringstream msgSStr;
01106 
01107   for (size_t i = 0; (i < tsv.getColumnCount(0)) &&
01108        (i < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size()) ; i++) {
01109 
01110     std::string columnName;
01111 
01112     if (tsv.cidx2cname(0, i, columnName) == TSV_OK) {
01113 
01114       if (columnName != m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName) {
01115         okHeaderLine = false;
01116         msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
01117         msgSStr << "column [" << (i + 1) << "]: found \"" << columnName << "\" but was expecting \"";
01118         msgSStr << m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName << "\"." << endl;
01119         invalidHeaderCount++;
01120       }
01121     } else {
01122 
01123       APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.cidx2cname returned unexpected error");
01124 
01125     } // if there was a TSV_ERROR
01126 
01127   } // for each column, inspect it
01128 
01129   if (invalidHeaderCount > 0) {
01130     if (invalidHeaderCount < 4) {
01131       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
01132     } else {
01133       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, inputTsvFileName + ": invalid TsvFile is missing the header line.", false);
01134     }
01135   }
01136 
01137   return okHeaderLine;
01138 
01139 }
01140 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
01141 /*****************************************************************************/
01142 /*****************************************************************************/
01143 /**
01144  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile:
01145  * Synopsis:
01146  * Helper function to the TSV file constructor,
01147  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
01148  *
01149  * Opens the Genotype Short Report TSV file, ready to read the first row
01150  * using the streaming readNextExperimentTSV API. Clears any data
01151  * from a previous open. 
01152  *
01153  *
01154  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnviroment.
01155  *
01156  * @return - void, throws an exception on open error.
01157  */
01158 /*****************************************************************************/
01159 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte)
01160 {
01161 
01162   // This should never happen unless a new constructor is created
01163   // that doesn't initialize columns.
01164 
01165   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
01166 
01167   clearData();
01168 
01169   if (Verbose::getParam().m_Verbosity > ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES) {
01170     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, ToStr("### TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readFile('") + m_tsvFileName + "')\n");
01171   }
01172 
01173   //
01174   m_tsv.m_optAutoTrim   = true; // remove '"'s
01175   m_tsv.m_optQuoteChar1 = 0;    // ignore "'"s
01176 
01177   if (m_tsv.open(m_tsvFileName) != TSV_OK) {
01178     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": failed opening input Tsv file.");
01179   }
01180 
01181   bool okColumnDefinitions = true;
01182 
01183   if (m_strictTsvColumnOrder) {
01184     okColumnDefinitions =
01185       _matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(m_tsvFileName, m_tsv);
01186   }
01187 
01188   if (okColumnDefinitions) {
01189     okColumnDefinitions = _initializeTsvColumns(m_tsvFileName, m_tsv);
01190   }
01191 
01192   m_tsvColumnCount = m_tsv.getColumnCount(0);
01193   m_tsvRow = 0;
01194 
01195   if (! okColumnDefinitions) {
01196     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": invalid input file detected.");
01197   }
01198 
01199 
01200 
01201   return;
01202 
01203 }
01204 // TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile
01205 /*****************************************************************************/
01206 /*****************************************************************************/
01207 /**
01208  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP:
01209  * Synopsis:
01210  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment.
01211  *
01212  * Streaming CHP files, where each CHP file is one experiment.
01213  * Read in the entire files worth of experiment gene data.
01214  * Fills in the 'm_rows' table with experiment data. 
01215  *
01216  * This is the place where override data from the override file supplants each
01217  * record of the CHP file as it is read in. This is how translation
01218  * is accomplished via the override file. The override data is
01219  * swapped for the CHP data here. 
01220  *
01221  * 
01222  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment 
01223  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model
01224  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall
01225  *            - the DMET2 std::map per gene copy number alleles
01226  * @param geneCopyNumber
01227  *            - the DMET3 std::map of gene copy number
01228  * 
01229  * @return - The number for records (markers) read for the experiment.
01230  */
01231 /*****************************************************************************/
01232 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map<std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
01233 {
01234 
01235   int chpRow       = 0;
01236   int recordsRead  = 0;
01237 
01238   clearData();
01239 
01240   if (!_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile(rte, ttm)) {
01241     return 0;
01242   }
01243 
01244   std::vector< affymetrix_calvin_io::MultiDataType > dataTypes;
01245   dataTypes.push_back(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[BI_TYPE]);
01246   dataTypes.push_back(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[MULTI_TYPE]);
01247 
01248   for (size_t j = 0; j <  dataTypes.size(); j++) {
01249 
01250     for (int i = 0; i < m_chpDataTypeSize[dataTypes[j]] ; i++) {
01251 
01252       affymetrix_calvin_data::DmetBiAllelicData dbad;
01253 
01254       m_chpData->GetEntry(dataTypes[j], i , dbad);
01255 
01256       // Not all probe sets are going to exist in the translation table,
01257       // if not then just drop the probeSet data on the floor.
01258       if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(dbad.name) < 0) {
01259         continue;
01260       }
01261 
01262 
01263       std::string allele1, allele2, originalAllele1, originalAllele2;
01264 
01265       originalAllele1.clear();
01266       originalAllele2.clear();
01267 
01268       if (! _getAllelesFromProbeSet(rte, ttm, dbad, allele1, allele2)) {
01269         continue;
01270       }
01271 
01272       // Genotype Override
01273       if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01274         std::vector< std::string > alleleOverride = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(m_experimentName, dbad.name);
01275         if (alleleOverride.size() > 0) {
01276           if ( CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1)  ) {
01277             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + dbad.name] = allele1;
01278           } else {
01279             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + dbad.name] = allele1 + "/" + allele2;
01280           }
01281           
01282           originalAllele1 = allele1;
01283           originalAllele2 = allele2;
01284           allele1 = alleleOverride[0];
01285           if ( alleleOverride.size() == 2 ) {
01286             allele2 = alleleOverride[1];
01287           }
01288           else {
01289             allele2 = "";
01290           }
01291         }
01292       }
01293 
01294       std::vector<std::string> newRow;
01295       chpRow++;
01296 
01297       newRow.resize(GT_END_FIELD_INDEX, "");
01298 
01299       newRow[GT_SAMPLE_INDEX]      = "N/A";
01300       newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX]  = m_experimentName;
01301       newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]       = _getGeneFromProbeSet(dbad.name, ttm);
01302       newRow[GT_EXTERNAL_ID_INDEX] = _getExternalIdFromProbeSet(dbad.name, ttm);
01303       newRow[GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX]   = dbad.name;
01304       newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX]     = allele1;
01305       newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX]     = allele2;
01306       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE1_INDEX] = originalAllele1;
01307 
01308       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE2_INDEX] = originalAllele2;
01309 
01310       m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = i;
01311 
01312       recordsRead++;
01313       m_experimentRowIndex[m_experimentName].push_back(chpRow - 1);
01314 
01315       m_probeSetRowIndex[dbad.name] = m_rows.size();
01316       m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01317 
01318       if ( geneCopyNumber.count(newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]) == 0 ) {
01319         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 2;
01320       }
01321       
01322       if ( allele1  == "0" ) {
01323         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]]  = 0;
01324       }
01325       else if ( !CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1) &&
01326                 (geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] == 2)
01327                 && ( allele2.empty() ) ){
01328         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 1;
01329       }
01330     }
01331 
01332   }
01333 
01334 
01335   return recordsRead;
01336 }
01337 // end  TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
01338 
01339 
01340 /*****************************************************************************/
01341 /*****************************************************************************/
01342 /**
01343  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentTsv
01344  * Synopsis:
01345  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment.
01346  *
01347  * Stream experiments from the Genotype Short Report file one experiment
01348  * at a time. Fills in the 'm_rows' table with experiment data. 
01349  *
01350  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
01351  * @param ttm  - the single instance translation table model
01352  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall 
01353  *            - the DMET2 std::map of per gene copy number alleles
01354  * @param geneCopyNumber
01355  *            - the DMET3 std::map of gene copy number
01356  * 
01357  * @return - The number for records (markers) read for the experiment.
01358  */
01359 /*****************************************************************************/
01360 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentTsv(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, const TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall)
01361 {
01362 
01363   bool   okExperimentGene   = true;
01364   int    recordsRead        = 0;
01365   std::string currentExperiment;
01366 
01367   clearData();
01368 
01369   if (m_tsvNextRow.size() > 0) {
01370     currentExperiment = m_tsvNextRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn];
01371     if (m_experimentRowIndex.count(currentExperiment) > 0) {
01372       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, "\n\nDMET2 genotype short report input files need to be sorted by experiment before they can be input.");
01373       sortTsvFileByExperiment(rte);
01374       APT_ERR_ABORT(currentExperiment + ": duplicate experiment detected.");
01375     }
01376 
01377     m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = m_tsvRow;
01378     m_rows.push_back(m_tsvNextRow);
01379     m_tsvNextRow.clear();
01380     recordsRead++;
01381   }
01382 
01383   std::string whiteSpace = " ";
01384   bool okColumnValues = true;
01385 
01386 
01387   for (int row = 0; okColumnValues && okExperimentGene &&
01388        (m_tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK); row++) {
01389     //
01390     std::vector<std::string> newRow;
01391     m_tsvRow++;
01392 
01393     newRow.resize(m_tsvColumnCount + 4, "");
01394 
01395     bool okRow = true;
01396 
01397     // Read in a row, one column at a time.
01398     for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
01399 
01400       std::stringstream lineSStr;
01401       std::string       columnName = getColumnName(m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]);
01402       // get the data
01403       std::string columnValue;
01404 
01405       if (m_tsv.get(0, tsvColumn, columnValue) != TSV_OK) {
01406         APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.get != TSV_OK");
01407       }
01408 
01409 
01410       Util::trimString(columnValue, whiteSpace.c_str());
01411 
01412       // empty and allowed?
01413       if (columnValue.empty()) {
01414         if (m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_emptyOk == false) {
01415           lineSStr << m_tsvFileName << ": ROW " << m_tsvRow  << " : ";
01416           lineSStr << columnName << " : ERROR missing required column.";
01417           Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
01418           okColumnValues = false;
01419         }
01420       }
01421       // validate it against regexp
01422       else if (!m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.FullMatch(columnValue)) {
01423         lineSStr << m_tsvFileName << ": ROW " << m_tsvRow  << " : COLUMN [";
01424         lineSStr << tsvColumn << "] " << columnName << " : ERROR invalid value: \"";
01425         lineSStr << columnValue << "\"";
01426         lineSStr << " (expecting " << m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.pattern();
01427         lineSStr << ")";
01428         lineSStr << endl;
01429 
01430         for (int j = 0 ; j < m_tsvColumnCount;  j++) {
01431           m_tsv.get(0, j, columnValue);
01432           lineSStr << columnValue << ",";
01433         }
01434         Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
01435         okColumnValues = false;
01436       }
01437       // Ingore row
01438       else if ((m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE != NULL) &&
01439                (m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE->PartialMatch(columnValue))) {
01440         okRow = false;
01441 
01442       }
01443       // put the column data in our row.
01444       newRow[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]] = columnValue;
01445     }
01446     // save our row to the data.
01447 
01448     // Genotype Override
01449     if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01450       std::vector< std::string > override = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn],  newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn]);
01451       if (override.size() ) {
01452         cerr << newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn] << " " << newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn] << " has override " << override[0] << endl;
01453         m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn] + "::" + newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn]] = newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX];
01454         newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX] = override[0];
01455         newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = "";
01456         if ( override.size() == 2 ) {
01457           newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = override[1];
01458         }
01459       }
01460     }
01461     // DMET2 Copy Number Zero
01462     if ( ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3 ) {
01463       std::string key = newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX] + ":" + newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX];
01464       if ( geneExperimentCopyNumberCall.count(key) > 0 ) {
01465         newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX] = "0";
01466         newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = "";
01467       }
01468         
01469     }
01470     
01471     if (okRow) {
01472 
01473       if (currentExperiment.empty()) {
01474         currentExperiment = newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn];
01475       }
01476       if (currentExperiment == newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn]) {
01477         m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = m_tsvRow;
01478         recordsRead++;
01479         m_experimentRowIndex[currentExperiment].push_back(m_tsvRow - 1);
01480 
01481         m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01482       } else {
01483         m_tsvNextRow = newRow;
01484         okExperimentGene = false;
01485       }
01486     }
01487   }
01488 
01489 
01490   if (! okColumnValues) {
01491     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": invalid input file data detected.");
01492   }
01493 
01494   if (m_rows.size() != recordsRead) {
01495     m_rows.resize(recordsRead);
01496   }
01497 
01498   return recordsRead;
01499 
01500 }
01501 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readExperimentNextGeneTsv
01502 /*****************************************************************************/

01504 
01505 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentBatchFolder(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map<std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
01506 {
01507   int chpRow       = 0;
01508   int recordsRead  = 0;
01509 
01510   clearData();
01511 
01512   if (!m_blockReader.nextSample()) {
01513     return 0;
01514   }
01515 
01516   m_experimentName = m_blockReader.getSampleName();
01517 
01518   if (m_genoCallCoder == NULL) {
01519     //
01520     // todo: should use call code table from IndexHeader section
01521     //
01522     int maxAlleles = m_blockReader.getMaxAlleles();
01523     m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(maxAlleles, "UCHAR", "1.0", '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
01524 
01525     if (ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3 && !rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreReportAllele) {
01526       ttm.setReportAlleles(*m_genoCallCoder);
01527     }
01528 
01529     m_chpVersion = "1.0";
01530     m_chpDataEncodingSize = "UCHAR";
01531     m_chpMaxAlleles = 2;
01532   }
01533 
01534   vector<pair<IndexRow, SampleList> >& vProbeSets = m_blockReader.getProbeSets();
01535   for (int i = 0; i < (int)vProbeSets.size(); i++) {
01536       IndexRow& row = vProbeSets[i].first;
01537       SampleList& samples = vProbeSets[i].second;
01538       
01539       string sProbeset = row.getProbeSetId();
01540       int numProbeSetRows = ttm.getProbeSetNumRows(sProbeset);
01541       if (numProbeSetRows == 0) {
01542         continue;
01543       }
01544 
01545       string strCallName = m_blockReader.getSampleCall(samples);
01546       for (int j = 0; j < numProbeSetRows; j++) {
01547           string allele1, allele2, originalAllele1, originalAllele2;
01548 
01549           originalAllele1.clear();
01550           originalAllele2.clear();
01551 
01552           if (!_getAllelesFromAbstractAlleles(rte, ttm, sProbeset, strCallName, allele1, allele2)) {
01553             break;
01554           }
01555 
01556           // Genotype Override
01557           if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01558             vector<string> alleleOverride = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(m_experimentName, sProbeset);
01559             if (alleleOverride.size() > 0) {
01560               if ( CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1)  ) {
01561                 m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + sProbeset] = allele1;
01562               } 
01563               else {
01564                 m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + sProbeset] = allele1 + "/" + allele2;
01565               }
01566           
01567               originalAllele1 = allele1;
01568               originalAllele2 = allele2;
01569               allele1 = alleleOverride[0];
01570               allele2 = (alleleOverride.size() == 2 ? alleleOverride[1] : "");
01571             }
01572           }
01573 
01574           vector<string> newRow;
01575           chpRow++;
01576 
01577           newRow.resize(GT_END_FIELD_INDEX, "");
01578 
01579           newRow[GT_SAMPLE_INDEX]      = "N/A";
01580           newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX]  = m_experimentName;
01581           newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]       = _getGeneFromProbeSet(sProbeset, ttm);
01582           newRow[GT_EXTERNAL_ID_INDEX] = _getExternalIdFromProbeSet(sProbeset, ttm);
01583           newRow[GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX]   = sProbeset;
01584           newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX]     = allele1;
01585           newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX]     = allele2;
01586           newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE1_INDEX] = originalAllele1;
01587 
01588           newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE2_INDEX] = originalAllele2;
01589 
01590           m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = recordsRead;
01591 
01592           recordsRead++;
01593           m_experimentRowIndex[m_experimentName].push_back(chpRow - 1);
01594 
01595           m_probeSetRowIndex[sProbeset] = m_rows.size();
01596           m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01597 
01598           if (geneCopyNumber.count(newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]) == 0) {
01599             geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 2;
01600           }
01601       
01602           if (allele1  == "0") {
01603             geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]]  = 0;
01604           }
01605           else if (!CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1) && geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] == 2 && allele2 == ""){
01606             geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 1;
01607           }
01608 
01609       } // for (numProbeSetRows)
01610 
01611   } // for (indexTable.rows)
01612 
01613   return recordsRead;
01614 }

01617 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCallsFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map<std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
01618 {
01619   int chpRow       = 0;
01620   int recordsRead  = 0;
01621 
01622   clearData();
01623 
01624   if (m_callsFileReader==NULL || !m_callsFileReader->nextExperiment()) {
01625     return 0;
01626   }
01627 
01628   m_experimentName = m_callsFileReader->getExperimentName();
01629 
01630   if ( m_genoCallCoder == NULL ) {
01631     //
01632     // TODO: We don't have access to all the meta-data from the chip files yet. Should put these in the header of the call file.
01633     // In the mean time I'm just guessing.
01634     // 
01635     m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(m_callsFileReader->getMaxAlleles(), "UCHAR", "1.0", '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
01636 
01637     if ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) &&  !rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreReportAllele) {
01638       ttm.setReportAlleles( *m_genoCallCoder);
01639     }
01640 
01641     m_chpVersion = "1.0";
01642     m_chpDataEncodingSize = "UCHAR";
01643     m_chpMaxAlleles = 2;
01644   }
01645 
01646   while (m_callsFileReader->nextRow()) {
01647   
01648       std::string sProbeset = m_callsFileReader->getProbeset();
01649       // Not all probe sets are going to exist in the translation table,
01650       // if not then just drop the probeSet data on the floor.
01651       if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(sProbeset) < 0) {
01652         continue;
01653       }
01654 
01655       std::string allele1, allele2, originalAllele1, originalAllele2;
01656 
01657       originalAllele1.clear();
01658       originalAllele2.clear();
01659 
01660       if (! _getAllelesFromAbstractAlleles(rte, ttm, sProbeset, m_callsFileReader->getCall(), allele1, allele2)) {
01661         continue;
01662       }
01663 
01664       // Genotype Override
01665       if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01666         std::vector< std::string > alleleOverride = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(m_experimentName, sProbeset);
01667         if (alleleOverride.size() > 0) {
01668           if ( CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1)  ) {
01669             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + sProbeset] = allele1;
01670           } else {
01671             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + sProbeset] = allele1 + "/" + allele2;
01672           }
01673           
01674           originalAllele1 = allele1;
01675           originalAllele2 = allele2;
01676           allele1 = alleleOverride[0];
01677           if ( alleleOverride.size() == 2 ) {
01678             allele2 = alleleOverride[1];
01679           }
01680           else {
01681             allele2 = "";
01682           }
01683         }
01684       }
01685 
01686       std::vector<std::string> newRow;
01687       chpRow++;
01688 
01689       newRow.resize(GT_END_FIELD_INDEX, "");
01690 
01691       newRow[GT_SAMPLE_INDEX]      = "N/A";
01692       newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX]  = m_experimentName;
01693       newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]       = _getGeneFromProbeSet(sProbeset, ttm);
01694       newRow[GT_EXTERNAL_ID_INDEX] = _getExternalIdFromProbeSet(sProbeset, ttm);
01695       newRow[GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX]   = sProbeset;
01696       newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX]     = allele1;
01697       newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX]     = allele2;
01698       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE1_INDEX] = originalAllele1;
01699 
01700       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE2_INDEX] = originalAllele2;
01701 
01702       m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = recordsRead;
01703 
01704       recordsRead++;
01705       m_experimentRowIndex[m_experimentName].push_back(chpRow - 1);
01706 
01707       m_probeSetRowIndex[sProbeset] = m_rows.size();
01708       m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01709 
01710       if ( geneCopyNumber.count(newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]) == 0 ) {
01711         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 2;
01712       }
01713       
01714       if ( allele1  == "0" ) {
01715         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]]  = 0;
01716       }
01717       else if ( !CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1) &&
01718                 (geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] == 2)
01719                 && ( allele2.empty() ) ){
01720         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 1;
01721       }
01722

01724   } // while (m_callsFileReader->nextRow())
